info.game_comments: Alex uses a cane during the closing credits chat.

(1, 1).clue: For Neptune it's about 60,000 Earth days long

(2, 1).clue: U.S. banks earn money by giving loans at interest rates regulated by this body created in 1913

(3, 1).clue: He followed "Stripes" & "Ghostbusters" with a star turn in the Somerset Maugham drama "The Razor's Edge"

(4, 1).clue: Elected Senator from Massachusetts in 2012, she championed the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau

(6, 1).clue: This state capital is 40 miles west of Las Vegas (New Mexico)

(1, 2).clue: A long tall tale, or a material to make sweaters

(2, 2).clue: The Americans with Disabilities Act says these must have Braille, even the drive-up ones

(3, 2).clue: Jackie Gleason got serious in "The Hustler" just a few years removed from being Ralph on this show

(4, 2).clue: 5-letter plural term for the sediment left in your glass

(6, 2).clue: Columbus' ship would've been at home on this Arizona river, a tributary of the Bill Williams River

(2, 3).clue: (Kelly of the Clue Crew shows a check on the monitor.)  A check contains lots of numbers: the number of the check itself,  an account number & this 9-digit number that identifies the bank involved in the transaction

(3, 3).clue: This "Liar Liar" searched for the truth in the 2007 mystery "The Number 23"

(4, 3).clue: Eric Clapton's 1974 cover of this song helped make Bob Marley famous worldwide

(5, 3).clue: Hillary Clinton's memoir about her time in the State Department:"Hard ____"

(6, 3).clue: An Orange County city, an El Salvador volcano or a hot, dusty wind that bears down on Los Angeles

(1, 4).clue: This 4-letter word comes from the Hebrew for "with certainty"

(2, 4).clue: This type of check is accepted without question & is signed by the banker it's named for

(3, 4).clue: Michael Chiklis got laughs as "The Commish" before going straight (& crooked) as Vic Mackey on this cop show

(4, 4).clue: Going from Portland to Eugene, Oregon takes you through this valley known for Pinot noir

(6, 4).clue: A California county, an ex-NBC soap opera, or a Philippine municipality near the Jaro River

(1, 5).clue: This adjective literally means having a skin disease caused by mites

(2, 5).clue: Founded with "Italy" in its name, it now has a more patriotic name & a red, white & blue logo

(3, 5).clue: She came to prominence as a standup comic before earning an Oscar nomination for "The Color Purple"

(4, 5).clue: Hans Zimmer said all the music in "Inception" was derived from her rendition of "Non, je ne regrette rien"

(6, 5).clue: It's the Italian name for the patron saint of sight, or for the area seen here on the Bay of Naples

(1, 1).clue: The brightest star in this constellation is Al Tarf, Arabic for "the end" (of one of the crab's legs)

(2, 1).clue: Since the late 1700s orange has symbolized this religious group in Ireland & Northern Ireland

(3, 1).clue: When Kirsten Dunst testified at a 2009 burglary trial, she was naturally described as this most important type of witness

(6, 1).clue: Van Morrison's music is often classified with American acts like the Righteous Brothers under "blue eyed" this

(1, 2).clue: We only have one labor for you: name this constellation that had a star go nova in 1934

(2, 2).clue: On June 20, 1756 dozens of Europeans defending Calcutta were thrown into this dungeon; few survived

(3, 2).clue: Your witness is unavailable during trial? Get a transcript of this, in which he testified under oath out of court

(5, 2).clue: This title for certain Christian clerics is sometimes preceded by "The"

(6, 2).clue: Van's first solo single was the 1967 pop classic about this "girl"

(1, 3).clue: The brighter the star, the lower the magnitude; this one, the brightest in Ursa Minor, is of the second magnitude

(2, 3).clue: In 1776 Benjamin Franklin sailed to France with this dark blue dye to sell to help fund the war effort

(3, 3).clue: Call Dr. Drew! A witness who's taken apart in cross-examination may be brought back for a redirect called this

(4, 3).clue: The development of this, a 2-word term coined by John McCarthy, is empowering humanoid robots

(5, 3).clue: It can be an explanatory caption that accompanies an illustration

(6, 3).clue: Van filmed 3 2009 L.A. shows so this bedridden, ailing one of "Charlie's Angels", a big fan, could watch

(1, 4).clue: Antares is the brightest star in this constellation; don't get stung

(2, 4).clue: Founded in Munich in 1921, this paramilitary group intimidated & assaulted Nazi opponents

(3, 4).clue: Since 1971 none of the 8,500 in witness security who obeyed the rules were killed, thanks to this service guarding them

(4, 4).clue: The "cultural" type of this "‑ism" says don't judge other societies by our standards because each has its own valid codes

(5, 4).clue: From the Latin for "soldier's pay", it's a fixed & regular payment, such as an allowance

(6, 4).clue: Van rose to prominence in this "Gloria"-ous band with a pronoun for a name

(2, 5).clue: In 1978 former Italian premier Aldo Moro was abducted & killed by this terrorist group

(3, 5).clue: Whittaker Chambers' testimony led to a perjury conviction in 1950 for this man believed to be a communist spy

(4, 5).clue: Cosmologist Sir Martin Rees wrote, "Countless other universes may exist" & for that idea he uses this 10-letter word

(6, 5).clue: "It's a marvelous night for" this lunar frolic, the title of one of Van's albums

(0, 0).clue: Ironically, this man worth tens of millions when he died in 1990 said his parents named him with a socialist logo in mind
